body.p:
Assistant Quartermaster's Office,
Louisville, Ky., June 17th 1864.
His Excellency
Gov Bramlette.
Sir.

Having assumed the duties of Disbursing Quartermaster at this post, in the place of Capt. L. C Forsythe, A. Q. M., it would be a great convenience to me to have a Notary Public in my office. I, therefore, would respectfully recommend Wm H. Tucker for the position, and request your Excellency to grant him a commission.

A. M. Tucker
Capt and A. Q. M
